--- title: "3.6 — Walrasian General Equilibrium Theory — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Dates *Tuesday, November 7, 2022* ::: ## Overview Today we finally look at the third Marginalist Revolutionary, Leon Walras, and his approach to general equilibrium. ## Readings ### Required Readings - Ch.11 "Walras and General Equilibrium Theory" in Landreth & Colander - Ch.13 "General Equilibrium and Welfare Economics" in Blaug ### Recommended Readings: - [ Marshall, Alfred, 1920 (1890), *Principles of Economics* (8th ed.)](https://www.econlib.org/library/Marshall/marP.html) The following Wikipedia entries can also provide more background: - [ Leon Walras](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Walras) - [ General Equilibrium Theory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_equilibrium_theory) ### Questions to Help Your Reading ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Participation/Discussion Board Posts Due 8 PM Fri Nov 4 This week's graded discussion is worth 5 points, and can be a combination of discussion in class, and/or posts on the Blackboard Discussion Board by 8 PM this Friday November 4. ## Tournament Votes The first round of the Classical division of the "Most Interesting Economist in History" tournament is live. Please post your votes in the discussion board.
